title: Trumpism
added: Trumpism is growing ideology in Europe. Parties such as Finnish political party [[Finns Party]] and France's [[National Rally]] are examples of trumpism in Europe<ref>https://www.helsinkitimes.fi/world-int/world-news/finland-in-the-world-press/16339-trumpism-comes-to-finland-exporting-happiness-and-kardashians-in-lapland-finland-in-the-world-press.html</ref><ref>https://www.vox.com/videos/2017/4/21/15387900/marine-le-pen-france-trump-elections</ref>

title: Trumpism
added: According to civil-rights lawyer [[Burt Neuborne]] and political theorist [[William E. Connolly]], Trumpist rhetoric employs [[Trope (literature)|tropes]] similar to those used by [[fascists]] in Germany{{sfn|Connolly|2017|p=7}} to persuade citizens (at first a minority) to give up democracy, by using a barrage of falsehoods, half-truths, personal invective, threats, [[xenophobia]], [[national-security]] scares, religious bigotry, [[white racism]], exploitation of economic insecurity, and a never-ending search for [[scapegoats]].{{sfn|Neuborne|2019|p=32}} Neuborne found twenty parallel practices,{{sfn|Rosenfeld|2019}} such as creating what amounts to an "alternate reality" in adherents' minds, through direct communications, by nurturing a fawning mass media and by deriding scientists to erode the notion of [[objective truth]];{{sfn|Neuborne|2019|p=34}} organizing carefully orchestrated mass rallies;{{sfn|Neuborne|2019|p=36}} bitterly attacking judges when legal cases are lost or rejected;{{sfn|Neuborne|2019|p=39}} using an uninterrupted stream of lies, half-truths, insults, vituperation and innuendo designed to marginalize, demonize and eventually destroy opponents;{{sfn|Neuborne|2019|p=36}} making [[jingoistic]] appeals to [[ultranationalist]] fervor;{{sfn|Neuborne|2019|p=36}} and promising to slow, stop and even reverse the flow of "undesirable" ethnic groups who are cast as scapegoats for the nation's ills.{{sfn|Neuborne|2019|p=37}}

title: Trumpism
deleted: An article for Politco called Trumpism [[McCarthyism]] on steroids.

title: Trumpism
added: According to Jeff Goodwin, a sociologist at New York University , ''Trumpism'' is ''characterized'' by five key elements, Social conservatism, Neoliberal capitalism,Economic nationalism, [[Nativism (politics)|Nativism,]] and [[White nationalism]].<ref>{{Cite web|last=CNN|first=Analysis by Zachary B. Wolf|title=Welcome to the transition|url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/09/politics/what-matters-november-9/index.html|access-date=2021-02-16|website=CNN}}</ref>
